page.title: 09Religion. Barbridge.
page.content: There are 2 Methodist Churches-Poole, dated 1834 and Barbridge, dating back to 1843 although part was rebuilt in 1955,following destruction by a stray bomb during World War 2.Both are in Nantwich Methodist Circuit(Minister Rev.Raymond Jones)and within the Chester and Stoke-on-Trent District of which Rev.Stuart Rhodes is Chairman. Anglicans are served by the Ecclesias- tical Parishes of Acton,Worleston and Bunbury,incumbants-Rev.Douglas Martin, Vicar of St.Mary's Acton & St.Oswald's Worleston and Rev.T.S.Atkin,Vicar of St.Boniface,Bunbury within the Diocese of Chester,Rev.Michael Baughen,Bishop. Roman Catholics worship at St.Anne's, Nantwich,Parish Priest,Rev.J.Warnock, or St.Thomas Becket,Tarporley,Parish Priest,Rev.A.C.Cogliolo,in the Shrews- bury Diocese.Other Free Churches are at Nantwich, Tarporley and Crewe.
